page.title: 07THE VILLAGE HALL
page.content: THE VILLAGE HALL WAS ERECTED IN COMMEMORATION OF THE CORONATION OF H,M, KING EDWARD VII IN 1902.THIS IS WRITTEN ON THE FRONT OF THE VILLAGE HALL.JOHN HENRY STOKES GAVE A Â£100 TOWARDS THE BUILDING OF THE VILLAGE HALL,AND PART OF IT WAS USED AS A READING ROOM FOR HIS GROOMS.FOR SOME TIME BEFORE MAY 1983 THE VILLAGE HALL WAS USED DURING THE DAY TIME AS AN EXTRA CLASS-ROOM FOR THE VILLAGE SCHOOL,NOW IT IS USED BY MANY DIFFERENT ORGANISATIONS IN THE VILLAGE AS A MEETING ROOM.RECENTLY A NEW WOODEN FLOOR HAS BEEN PUT DOWN,AND THE KITCHEN HAS BEEN MODERNISED SO THAT TEAS COULD BE SERVED.
